column3:
tested ACK. I'd still prefer to see:

- a comment in the docstring about the subtests consuming discrete inputs, and that there should be no shared state between subtests.
- a comment explaining why epsilon is 1000. What is this testing?
- the call to count_bytes removed and using the RPC to get size directly. The test here is for the feerate, not that getrawtranasaction can correctly seri

- Dropped count_bytes and clarified the settxfee assertion in 5876a4da9bf93c32efc42ebaf3c11f639608f8ec.\n- Expanded docstring in 74d74d9f68ed3a5dd9fd268fdb0ef5985ae670a0.\n- Squashed 74d74d9f68ed3a5dd9fd268fdb0ef5985ae670a0 -> a641eba17ae97ff80d7d1c272b7f86f94dfc70fd ([pr/bumpfee-fragile.4](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/bumpfee-fragile.4) -> [pr/bumpfee-fragile.5](https://githu
retested ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9701/commits/a641eba17ae97ff80d7d1c272b7f86f94dfc70fd. Changes look good. Thanks!

Rebased a641eba17ae97ff80d7d1c272b7f86f94dfc70fd -> f85ac54e2429ad70c8bd4b2dbdf9d4107fd81f3f ([pr/bumpfee-fragile.5](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/bumpfee-fragile.5) -> [pr/bumpfee-fragile.6](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/bumpfee-fragile.6)) because of renames in #9956.
I know this pre-dates your PR, but since you're changing the line, can you change this to not use input as a variable name. input is a built-in Python function. Perhaps `txin` is better?

I see that you've tried to clarify what this assert is doing, but it's still pretty obscure to me. Why should the difference between the desired feerate and the actual feerate be at least 1000 satoshis/byte? Can you add a comment explaining?\n\nI also think that this inequality is more clearly expressed as actual_feerate >= desired_feerate + 1000 (ie the thing we're asserting is on the left side
I think this is more clearly expressed as:\n\n`bumped_len = rbf_node.getrawtransaction(bumped_tx["txid"], True)["size"]` (ie not relying on size being the length of the serialized string // 2)
There is a `count_bytes` helper function in util, that also checks that the bytes are hex encoded.

It's checking that difference between requested and actual feerate is less than 1000, not greater than 1000. Replaced 1000 with `epsilon` variable to maybe make comparison clearer in 779ea9c214c1cf508efea59b8ebaaec424fdac44.
